questions.question: There were ……………. ten students in the class.
questions.description: We use under to mean less than or younger than.

questions.question: Parts of the country are ……………. sea level.
questions.description: We use below in measurements of temperature and height.

questions.question: The climbers stopped a few hundred meters ……………. the top of the mountain.
questions.description: We use below when one thing is not directly under another thing.

questions.question: Who is that child sitting ……………. your mother?
questions.description: Beside means at the side of or next to.

questions.question: He can play all the musical instruments ……………. the violin.
He has a number of criminals ……………. his friends.
The office was closed ……………. the whole of May.
questions.description: We use during to talk about the whole of the period.

questions.question: I met him ……………. my stay in Germany.
questions.description: We use during to say that something happens between the beginning and end of an event/activity.

questions.question: I stayed in bed all day ……………. going to work.
questions.description: Instead is not used alone as a preposition. We use the two words instead of.

questions.question: We arrived ……………. to get good seats.
questions.description: In time means before the last moment.

questions.question: The trains are never …………….
questions.description: If something is on time, it is neither late nor early.

questions.question: The movie is quite exciting …………….
questions.description: At the end means at the point where something stops.
